snippet: A Brooklyn Democrat, Simcha Felder, agreed to change parties, saying it would better serve his district.
abstract: Republican Party, which emerged from Election Day with its leadership of the New York State Senate in serious doubt, persuades Brooklyn Democrat Simcha Felder, to switch sides, increasing the odds that Republicans would retain control of the chamber; both parties are predicting they will control a 63-seat Senate after all ballots have been counted.
lead_paragraph: A Brooklyn Democrat, Simcha Felder, agreed to change parties, saying it would better serve his district.

headline.seo: Newly Elected State Senator, Simcha Felder, Defects to G.O.P.
headline.main: Newly Elected State Senator Defects to Republican Party
headline.print_headline: Newly Elected State Senator Defects to Republican Party
